page.title: 13MR BLAKENEY
page.content: Mr Blakeney has been the huntsman at the E.K.H. for 10 years.The E.K.H. has been in Elham for 200 years.Hounds are trained by putting a collar round an older hound's neck. The old hound teaches the young hound. The hounds are fed four times a day. Raw flesh is collected from the farms. Huntng takes place 2 times a week on Wednesday & Saturday during the season. Hounds kill foxes by breaking their necks.The E.K.H. covers the land from New Romney,Ashford,Canterbury and Dover.The hounds are always counted in pairs-couples. They are walked as puppies by local people and then before they are a year old they go back to join the main pack and learn how to hunt. They usually hunt till they are 8 years old. Mr Blakeney blows his horn to tell the hounds and hunters what to do.
